formalText: She can switch for awhile to 9:15 from 8:30 on Wednesday?
We don't know ultimately if the ECT is going to make a significant difference for her.
Told her it's hard to tell from how often these will come back after the ECT.
She said specifically, "I'm afraid I'll kill myself" and I don't want to go back to the hospital but I have to.
I sent her home and asked her to leave some kind of message a little later this afternoon to let me know where things are at.
We are scheduled tomorrow morning, and then she has treatment tomorrow.
She thinks a lot about killing myself and she is not not sure she has the courage so things are not too good.
She doesn't know what to do.
She keeps thinking things will get better
She has now  had a setback so she is kind of feeling worse about things and not as hopeful or optimistic as she was.
She doesn't know quite what to call it.
Horror and depression isn't quite right, suicide isn't quite either
She says, "I very much want to give up and want not to give up".
She said,  "I'm afraid I'm not going to make it.
I'm afraid I'll kill myself".
She is quite scared
and pretty helpless
She had pain and horror and felt trapped in the fear that she felt started yesterday afternoon.
When she is of the environment of the hospital, a lot of this comes to her
almost like it is quite biological.
Earlier, she was talking about getting help said this was after she started to feel a little bit better in the hospital anywhere.
It is hard for her to remember feeling that way when you were out of it.

Earlier, she was terrified that the therapist would find out that she was depressed and wanted to talk about anything but the issue. There was something very dangerous about the possibility of getting the help that she wanted.
